decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with artifacts like Moxen, Sol Ring, and Grim Monolith to play powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. It aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void while also utilizing cards like Time Vault and Mystic Forge for value. The synergy between artifacts like Manifold Key and The One Ring provide additional utility and power to overwhelm opponents in a fast-paced aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on using a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. It utilizes powerful control cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and LÃ³rien Revealed to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also leveraging card advantage with cards like Brainstorm, Ancestral Recall, and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to further hinder the opponent's ability to develop their board. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing for the recursion of key creatures or artifacts from the graveyard.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through a combination of counterspells, card draw, and removal spells. By utilizing powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Force of Will, along with efficient removal like Fatal Push, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while slowly building up its own resources. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and flexibility in the late game. Overall, the deck's goal is to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage and careful decision-making.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive artifacts, focusing on locking down the opponent's resources while quickly building up its own board presence. By utilizing powerful mana acceleration like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, this deck can quickly deploy threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Patchwork Automaton. The inclusion of cards like Sphere of Resistance, Trinisphere, and Crucible of Worlds further hinders the opponent's ability to respond effectively, allowing the deck to outpace and overpower the opposition.

This deck focuses on overwhelming your opponent with powerful control elements and card advantage, utilizing various spells and artifacts to disrupt their game plan and slowly grind them down. By carefully managing your resources and utilizing cards like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Gifts Ungiven, you can control the pace of the game and outmaneuver your opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and versatility to your strategy, allowing you to recur key cards and stay ahead in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. With powerful cards like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Gifts Ungiven, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win condition. By efficiently managing resources and utilizing powerful cards such as Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of flexibility and value to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful card Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana acceleration while also running a variety of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card recursion and flexibility in game strategy. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces, draw cards, and generate a large amount of mana to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck revolves around using card draw and mana acceleration to quickly assemble a powerful combo with cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Thundertrap Trainer. It aims to generate a significant amount of mana and card advantage in order to overwhelm the opponent and win the game through a explosive series of plays. The inclusion of cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Swords to Plowshares also provides additional utility and ways to interact with the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Stock Up to generate card advantage and mana to combo off quickly. The deck also utilizes key artifacts like Moxen and Black Lotus to accelerate its game plan. Additionally, cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den provide a valuable companion option for added consistency. By efficiently drawing cards, generating mana, and controlling the board, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and win the game in the early turns of the match.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing aggressive hatebears to disrupt opponents while applying pressure with efficient creatures. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan through cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, while also having a disruptive mana base with Wasteland and disruptive artifacts like Void Mirror. The deck also includes powerful card draw options like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer, allowing for card advantage in addition to disruption and aggression.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and disruptive creatures to dominate the game. By combining counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce with removal like Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the opponent's board while drawing cards and digging for key spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for constant recursion of valuable permanents, creating a resilient and versatile control shell. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and strong threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on using disruptive spells and creature removal to control the game while leveraging powerful card draw and manipulation effects. By controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategies, the deck aims to out-value and outlast its opponent, ultimately winning through attrition. The use of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and resilience to the deck's game plan. With a mix of efficient removal, counterspells, and card advantage, this Dimir Control deck seeks to dominate the game through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of the deck revolves around utilizing Mishra's Workshop and artifact mana acceleration to quickly cast powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem. The deck also focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Sphere of Resistance. Additionally, the deck has a strong land destruction theme with cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures and resource denial while still having access to powerful utility cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling and executing the Doomsday combo, using cards like Ancestral Recall, Black Lotus, and Brainstorm to draw and set up the perfect combination of cards. The goal is to win the game using Thassa's Oracle and ending the game on the spot, often in a single turn. The deck also includes counter magic like Mindbreak Trap and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' strategies. With careful planning and resource management, this deck aims to achieve a swift and decisive victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt and slow down the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with efficient aggressive creatures. The hatebears such as Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex hinder the opponent's ability to cast spells, while Anointed Peacekeeper and White Plume Adventurer provide early aggression. The deck also utilizes powerful mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to quickly deploy threats. The mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine further adds to the disruption plan.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing various spells and disruptive elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to efficiently handle threats and maintain control over the game tempo while also utilizing the Gifts Ungiven package for card advantage and flexibility. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value and recursion capabilities to the deck. The synergy between various spells and the ability to adapt to different situations make this deck a formidable force in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.
